segments.text: I can’t believe how careless the woman is, just standing there while water floods the kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s so focused on that plate, like nothing else matters.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being sneaky, but she’s too distracted to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I’m furious that she’s letting this happen—doesn’t she see the puddle?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on the stool is asking for trouble, and she’s not even looking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she’s failing at her job right now, and it’s frustrating to watch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is going to ruin the floor, and she doesn’t even care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to shake her and tell her to pay attention.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for a cookie, like it’s no big deal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is making me so mad—I can’t stand irresponsibility.
segments.speaker: PAR
